fields.title: National adaptation strategy
National adaptation action plan
Subnational adaptation strategy or action plans
National (or subnational) transport strategy or transport plans which focuses on adaptation to climate change or extreme events
Transport sector plans (e.g road, rail, etc.) which consider adaptation to climate change or extreme events
Action plans from infrastructure managers or service providers, which focus on adaptation to climate change or extreme events
Risk management plans which focus on adaptation to climate change or extreme events
National transport standards or guidelines for design and operation which focus on adaptation to climate change or extreme weather events
Emergency protocols which focus on adaptation to climate change or extreme events
Any other plan, strategy, programme, guidelines, initiative, etc. that directly or indirectly considers transport adaptation and that you consider relevant in the context of this questionnaire
Could you provide any qualitative information on the state of implementation of adaptation measures for the transport sector?
fields.description:
Please describe briefly: 
To what level is the current transport infrastructure already adapted to climate change?
Have transport services already undergone procedural change?
Have adaptation measures in the transport sector been implemented or are they still in the planning phase?

fields.title: If needed, please insert additional comments on this topic, e.g. further qualifying the above information or which provide additional information
B1 Climate change:  Please list any major recent (since 2008) assessments or study in your country on vulnerability, resilience or adaptation of transport at the national (or subnational level).

B2 Extreme weather events only: Please list any major recent (since 2008) assessments or study in your country on the vulnerability, resilience or adaptation of transport at the national (or subnational) level.
fields.description: (note: Here we ask for relevant additional studies which only consider extreme events but not climate change , for example, disaster risk management. Studies which consider both - extreme weather events under current and future conditions - should be inserted under section B1)

fields.title: B3 Please list any relevant national (or subnational) research programme important for the adaptation of transport to climate change or to extreme weather events.
fields.description: Note: We are looking for broader (institutional) research programmes, not for specific research projects.

fields.title: B4 Please list any relevant national (or subnational) knowledge and information initiative, platform or similar initiatives important for the adaptation of transport to climate change or to extreme weather events
fields.description: (e.g. Climate ADAPT at the European level: http://climate-adapt.eea.europa.eu)

fields.title: B5 Please list any systematically collected data that is relevant for assessing the impacts of climate change or extreme weather events on transport, disruption of transport operations, extraordinary infrastructure reconstruction costs, etc.

Optional: Are you aware of interesting cases in your country on the vulnerability of a critical part of the transport system (bridge, coastal road sectionâ€¦) to extreme weather events, which could be relevant to climate change adaptation?
fields.description: If yes, please provide some further information. We might want to explore this as case studies:

fields.title: If necessary, please insert additional comment on this topic:
C1 a. Overall transport system
C1 b. Roads
C1 c. Railways
C1 d. Air transport
C1 e. Inland Waterborne transport
C1 f. Maritime transport
C1 g. Urban transport
C1 h. other

C2 Describe briefly how these bodies might interact, e.g. how are responsibilities distributed, how are they inter-dependant, what interaction takes place with other bodies at subnational levels, etc.
C3 Are there any private stakeholders in your country (transport companies, unions, NGOs, etc.) which are particular active regarding transport adaptation?
fields.description: These private stakeholders could be an additional source of information to be consulted by EEA.

fields.title: If necessary, please insert additional comment on this topic:
D1 What do you consider as barriers to better adaptation of transport to climate change?
D2 Which EU activities could support a better adaptation of transport in your country?
If necessary, please insert additional comment on this topic:
